answers.answer: While we would all love to have the perfect blood markers and ideal weight that just not always possible.... More important is her geno type,and liver condition. Her doctor should due regular cbc'a to keep an eye on the others..... Once she starts treatment its very important to make sure she takes all of her meds and pretty much on time.......I'm sure others will be around also to answer, welcome to the forum and its nice of you to care about your sister.

The only thing I would think would be in question is the cholesterol..You have to eat 20 grams of fat 30 min before you take the incevik. It worries me I have gained like 15 lbs already but you only have to take it for 12 weeks. The others can be controlled with medication.

As for her weight I am sure she would lose a lot during treatment. No she will not feel better right away.She will feel horrible because that is how the meds you have to take make you feel. She will possibly be nauseous, fatigued, depressed. On the up side, by losing weight, she may eliminate the borderline diabetic aspect and her cholesterol will probably decrease.Good luck and God bless.
